tool.name: Get.otus
tool.description: Get otus containing sequences from specified groups
tool.command:
## create symlinks to input datasets ln -s "$otu" otu.dat && ln -s "$group_in" group_in.dat && #if $groupnames.source == 'accnos': ln -s "$groupnames.accnos_in" groupnames.accnos_in.dat && #end if
echo 'get.otus( list=otu.dat, group=group_in.dat #if $label: ,label=${ str($label).replace(",","-") } #end if #if $groupnames.source == 'groups': ,groups=${ str($groupnames.groups).replace(",","-") } #else ,accnos=groupnames.accnos_in.dat #end if )' | sed 's/ //g' ## mothur trips over whitespace | mothur

param.name: label
param.label: label - OTU Label
param.help: select exactly one label. If none selected, the first label in your file will be used

param.name: source
param.label: Select Group Names from
param.option: A History Group Name Accnos Dataset

param.name: groups
param.label: groups - Pick groups to include
param.help: At least one group must be selected

param.name: accnos_in
param.label: accnos - Group Names from your history

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The get.otus_ command selects otus from a list_ containing sequences from a specific group or set of groups.
.. _list: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/List_file .. _get.otus: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Get.otus
v.1.20.0: Updated to Mothur 1.33
